oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MODEL-REFERENCE CASCADE CONTROL OF NONLINEAR-SYSTEMS - APPLICATION TO AN UNSTABLE CSTR
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHIDAMBARAM, M
YUGENDER, C
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: input output linearization
stirred tank reactor
batch reactors
cascade control
nonlinear control
relative order 2
pid action
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The design of a model reference cascade controller is analyzed for the control of a nonlinear system x = f (x) + g(x)u + d(t), y = cx which has a relative order two. Integral and derivative control actions are incorporated in the control law. Theoretical analysis on robustness of the proposed control scheme under process/model parameters uncertainty is provided. The controller design method is applied theoretically to the concentration control of a non-isothermal CSTR which has a severe nonlinearity and steady-state multiplicities.
